title: TLS/SSL
description:
Enabling TLS for HTTPS and HTTP/2.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

public_key.title: Public key
public_key.description:
Absolute path to the public key, or relative to the current working directory.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

private_key.title: Private key
private_key.description:
Absolute path to the private key, or relative to the current working directory.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

disabled.title: Disable TLS
disabled.description:
A flag to disable TLS (useful while in development).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

min_version.title: Minimum TLS version
min_version.description:
Minimum TLS version supported. When specifiying very old and insecure versions under TLS12 you must provide the `ciphers_list`.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

enable_mtls.title: Enable Mutual Authentication
enable_mtls.description:
Whether to enable or not Mutual Authentication. When mTLS is enabled, **all KrakenD endpoints** require clients to provide a known client-side X.509 authentication certificate. KrakenD relies on the systemâ€™s CA to validate certificates.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/mutual-authentication/

curve_preferences.title: Curve identifiers
curve_preferences.description:
The list of all the identifiers for the curve preferences. Use `23` for CurveP256, `24` for CurveP384 or `25` for CurveP521.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

prefer_server_cipher_suites.title: Prefer server cipher suites
prefer_server_cipher_suites.description:
Enforces the use of TLS versions and cipher suites configured, and blocks all traffic not in the range.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/mutual-authentication/

cipher_suites.title: Cipher Suites
cipher_suites.description:
The list of cipher suites as defined in the documentation.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

ca_certs.title: CA certificates
ca_certs.description:
An array with all the CA certificates you would like to load to KrakenD **when using mTLS**, in addition to the certificates present in the system's CA. Each certificate in the list is a relative or absolute path to the PEM file. If you have a format other than PEM, you must convert the certificate to PEM using a conversion tool. See also `disable_system_ca_pool` to avoid system's CA.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/

disable_system_ca_pool.title: Disable system's CA
disable_system_ca_pool.description:
Ignore any certificate in the system's CA. The only certificates loaded will be the ones in the `ca_certs` list when true.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/
